title: sepolia node stalled at block 1460320
body:
### Description

I have two besu/lighthouse nodes which have stalled at block 1460320.  A besu/prysm node has been reported has having the same issue (see https://forkmon.sepolia.ethdevops.io/ for details).

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: besu/v22.7.0-RC1/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-17

I think this was just fixed yesterday: [#4069](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/4069). We are in the process of the final tests of a hotfix release (22.4.4) which will be released by the end of the day.

Unfortunately once this happens, the database is corrupted and we can not recover from that. The only way forward is to sync the node from scratch again (with the fixed release).
Does this really require a complete resync?  For this and similar problems, is there no way in which the database can be pruned such that it is rolled back to a known good (user-provided) height?
Will there also be a release for the 22.7.0-RC1, given that this fixes other known issues with bonsai?

We discussed a hotfix to the 22.7.0-RC series to include #4069 but decided to instead aggregate all of the bonsai and critical merge fixes in a final 22.4.4 release.  The next RC series release will be July 20th.  

Most of the merge related difference between what is in 22.7 series that is not in 22.4.4 are fixes for corner cases and hive suite compliance.  @mcdee If there is a strong desire to run the 22.7 release candidate series, I think we could expedite an offcycle RC2
Closing 'prior value rolling change' as fixed with #4069.
